TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content: The most amazing thing about Sal\_vager's post count: click on his profile and look at his post history. Every one of his posts was detailed, helpful and meaningful. What a guy. Miss him so much ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

>

Yeah! Isn't that great?

Yeah, I considered [@Red Iron Crown](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/12858-red-iron-crown/) one of those forum friends I'd gladly buy a steak and beer somewhere. Hope he sticks around.
I agree.

I read somewhere that Moderators have to read every link posted to make sure it's not something like spam. So do you get a special notification (Or something similar) whenever someone posts a topic/reply with a link in it?

And has there been any bad instances with links? Not language in a video. I know about those, but like scam links and whatnot. Or can you sometimes tell it's bad to click on based on the URL? I was just curious after I thought of the initial question ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

We don't check every single link because we can't, and most of the spam links are in the first few posts of a new account anyway, which is why those need approval. Links posted after an account is out of the queue are almost never problematic.
[@Vanamonde](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/27914-vanamonde/) but has the team ever had to ban a user who somehow slipped under the metaphorical radar?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, HansonKerman said:
> 
> 
> [@Vanamonde](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/27914-vanamonde/) but has the team ever had to ban a user who somehow slipped under the metaphorical radar?
> 

Yes, it can happen, but not often. Bots get smarter every day and we probably get dumber every day ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
If you get banned is there an appeal process?

> 
> 
> 13 minutes ago, Ultimate Steve said:
> 
> 
> If you get banned is there an appeal process?
> 

Normally, yes. Even spammers can appeal. The ban message would usually include an email address to write to if there are any questions, or the banned person can contact Squad through the [support page](https://www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/en/?page_id=23) of the main web site.
Has the forum been sluggish/screwy today?

Kay
Hang on. Can moderators ban other moderators?
Can you see our direct messages?

No, I have not noticed the forum being sluggish lately. No, moderators are immune to warns and bans. And no, we cannot see PMs unless one of the involved parties reports a post, in which case we can all see the entire PM exchange.
